title: Higher-order Runnables
author: Federico Peralta Schaffner
summary: A higher-order function is a function that takes one or more functions as arguments and that might return a function as its result. Here we take an informal approach to higher-order functions by showing how to apply this functional programming concept to Runnable instances.

title: Functional Default Arguments
author: Federico Peralta Schaffner
summary: Java lacks a built-in way to define default arguments for methods and constructors. Over the years, several approaches have been proposed, each with its pros and cons. The most widely-known one uses method overloading, though varargs, null values, the builder pattern and even maps have been used as well. Here we propose a new approach based on functional constructs.

title: Basic Functional Constructs
author: Federico Peralta Schaffner
summary: In this issue of The Bounds of Java Newsletter, we present four basic functional constructs that every developer should be aware of. We also introduce the concept of monad, which is very important to write useful functional code, but we carefully avoid digging into the intricacies of category theory.
